3.26.18  12:28 pm   3.20.18  3:52 pm I don't know if this is exactly what you were talking trying to say, but one thing I took away from it is playing "C Db Eb E F G Ab Bb" over resolving V7 chords. I have done some experimenting with it and I fucking love that sound now! do you have any suggestions for recordings/musicians/eras I could transcribe which use similar sounds/notes to that? 

     pretty much anything, in a minor key

3.26.18  9:39 am   hey, bill. i've been working for 2 years to get into the composition studio at my college. today is the day i seem to be learning they haven't accepted me for the third time in a row. so i'm kinda feeling like i'm not supposed to write music because i'm not good at it. do you have any comforts or words of wisdom for a sad boy like me

     most of the best songs in the world were not written at a composition college

     a famous number

3.26.18  1:41 am   do you ever consider changing all the colors on this website, to make things more interesting?

     i've decided to make the content interesting, and choose colors in a supportive role

3.26.18  12:45 am   Hi Bill,
My ex-girlfriend and I broke up (we're still good friends though). She said that I became more awkward around her in person and she didn't want to ruin our relationship. I told her that I completely understood, but in all honesty, I hate myself for fucking up what we had together. I don't know why I became so awkward around her in person, and it really irritates me that I messed up with her, because I really did love her. I just didn't want to come off as clingy and weird in public. I'm kind of a shy and quiet person most of the time, and it takes me a while to warm up to someone and show them the real me. The only reason I didn't show her the love and affection that she deserved in public is because we only really see each other in school, and I didn't want anyone looking at me strangely. I get embarrassed and nervous easily, and I would have been panicking in my head if people looked and laughed at me while I was being affectionate t owards h er. The real issue here is that I still have feelings for her. I miss what we had together. I want to try again and be less awkward around her, but I feel like she'll turn me down this time because she might find someone else or I might fuck it up again. I don't know if I'll ever find a girl like her again. I feel like a hopeless piece of shit. What do I do to make myself feel better in a time like this? (sorry for the long ass question btw)

Sincerely Yours, "D"
(p.s. I love your content!)

     i think it's time for you to move on. go exploring. learn some new things

     no

3.25.18  11:12 pm   do you know if it is sensible to use two fingers to hold down three strings on guitar? i'm new to this and can't tell if this will be an issue down the road or not. (A chord w/ 3 fings on 2nd fret, apparently your fingers can't be too big but i think mine may be exceptional. can get it well with just 2)

     for that chord, i use 3 fingers but i think most people use 1. i've never seen anyone do it with 2 but i'm sure you can
